story.kicker_image_caption: A massive fire that broke out at the Pulgaon Central Armament Depot near Nagpur in Maharashtra killed 16 personnel, including two army officers and injured 19 others.

listicle_content.listicle: It is also reported that plastic shell of Mines had developed cracks explosive TNT flowed out from the ammunition.
Total 130Tonn ammunition gutted down in the incident killing 19 people.
A proposal of crack repair through plastic welding was being considered by DGQA.
The fire, which broke out around midnight today in one of the sheds at the country\'s biggest arms depot, spread rapidly.
In 2005, a similar massive fire broke out at Pulgaon Central Armament Depot.
Spread across 10,000 hectares, the central ammunition depot at Pulgaon is country\'s biggest ammunition depot.

story.storykicker: According to Sources, there were serious quality issues with Anti-tank mines stored in CAD Pulgaon. Mines are otherwise considered stable ammunition.
story.storybody:
Investigators are looking into the sabotage angle in the Pulgaon blast in Maharashtra that killed 16 personnel, including two army officers.

According to Sources, there were serious quality issues with Anti-tank mines stored in CAD Pulgaon. Mines are otherwise considered stable ammunition.

Here's all you need to know:

{funfacts}
  1. It is also reported that plastic shell of Mines had developed cracks explosive TNT flowed out from the ammunition.
  2. Total 130Tonn ammunition gutted down in the incident killing 19 people.
  3. A proposal of crack repair through plastic welding was being considered by DGQA.
  4. The fire, which broke out around midnight today in one of the sheds at the country's biggest arms depot, spread rapidly.
  5. In 2005, a similar massive fire broke out at Pulgaon Central Armament Depot.
  6. Spread across 10,000 hectares, the central ammunition depot at Pulgaon is country's biggest ammunition depot.
{funfacts}

ALSO READ:
Massive fire at country's largest arms depot kills 16, sabotage not ruled out

Fire at Army's largest ammunition depot in Pulgaon: Accidental blaze or sinister sabotage?
